intro: Hesperochiron ciliatus, commonly known as the silky leaf orchid, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its delicate, hairy leaves and small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its botanical features include a sympodial growth habit and a rhizomatous root system, which aid in its survival in humid climates. The flowers, which bloom in late spring, are usually pale green to yellowish in color and attract various pollinators.
